sense.name: compensate for, counterbalance
sense.examples: His skills offset his opponent's superior strength. Whenever anybody buys their auto insurance from us, we offset roughly the first 2000 miles worth of greenhouse gas. Even if there was any validity to his comments, he offset them by handling the situation like a coward. Visitors are required to purchase a pass to help offset maintenance and operational costs. Favorable incentives are offered to offset costs and reward growth

sense.name: form a bend in something, as a wall or pipe
sense.commentary: Note: used in the construction industry
sense.examples: If we offset the two halves of a radial tiling along one of the straight lines, we obtain a spiral tiling. If you must offset to miss a joist, etc. in the attic, use two 45-degree ells with a short pipe between them. The other two beams are offset at 90 degrees to each other. Instead, he offset them to allow separate venting to the ceiling from each.

sense.name: cause to smear or transfer to a printing surface
sense.commentary: Note: used in the printing industry
sense.examples: The image is "offset" onto the blanket and then to paper. The image areas are are coated with ink, which is offset onto the rubber.

sense.name: create by offset printing
sense.commentary: Note: used in the printing industry
